H0.text: Fungi are organisms that were once classified as prokaryotes in the domain Bacteria but are now classified as eukaryotes.

H1.text: Plantae are the group that now contains some prokaryotes that were once classified in the domain Bacteria.

H2.text: Archaea are prokaryotes that were once classified in the domain Bacteria but are now classified as Archaea.

H3.text: Protista are some prokaryotes that were once classified in the domain Bacteria.

A4.text: The term 'bacteria' traditionally included all prokaryotes, but after the discovery in the 1990s, prokaryotes were split into two groups: Bacteria and Archaea.
